Settings.Name: browser.send_pings
Settings.Description: As part of the new HTML5 standard, "a" tags can now have a ping attribute that will be visited by the browser when the user clicks the link. See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Browser.send_pings for more info.

Settings.Name: browser.send_pings.require_same_host
Settings.FriendlyName: Require the pings to be on the same host
Settings.Description: See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Browser.send_pings.require_same_host for more info.

Settings.Name: browser.send_pings.max_per_link
Settings.FriendlyName: Maximum number of links to ping enabled

Settings.Name: dom.storage.enabled
Settings.Description: The Web Applications 1.0 specification defines a mechanism allowing web pages to store information with a web browser (similar to cookies) called "client-side session and persistent storage." Although use of session storage is subject to a user's cookie preferences, this preference allows it to be disabled entirely. See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Dom.storage.enabled for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.battery.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to see battery life. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/BatteryManager for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.telephony.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to make and receive phone calls. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/WebAPI/Security/WebTelephony for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.event.clipboardevents.enabled
Settings.Description: Force interaction from yourself before the browser can look at the clipboard. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Preferences/Preference_reference/dom.event.clipboardevents.enabled for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.enable_performance
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to get information about DNS resolution time, connection setup time, transfer time and some other timing interfaces from ResourceTiming API. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Reviews/Firefox/NavigationTimingAPI for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.indexeddb.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to store data on your pc to enable fast searching. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/IndexedDB for more information.

Settings.Name: dom.gamepad.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables Gamepad support. Security wise, this can result in USB device id enumeration. See http://www.w3.org/TR/gamepad/ for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.vr.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to interact with virtual reality devices. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox/Releases/36#Interfaces.2FAPIs.2FDOM for more info.

Settings.Name: dom.event.contextmenu.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to control the rightclick context menu

Settings.Name: dom.broadcastchannel.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to broadcast messages to all browsing contextx in the same user agent

Settings.Name: dom.ipc.plugins.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browsers plugins to communicate between processes

Settings.Name: dom.server-events.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to initiate data from server sent events

Settings.Name: dom.vibrator.enabled
Settings.Description: Enables the browser to control vibrate

Settings.Name: dom.webcomponents.enabled
Settings.Description: Determines if Web Components are enabled or disabled. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Web_Components for at description of web components.

Settings.Name: dom.webnotifications.enabled
Settings.FriendlyName: Used to display desktop notifications to the user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/notification

Settings.Name: plugin.state.flash
Settings.Description: 0: never activate, 1: ask to activate, 2: always activate

Settings.Name: plugins.update.notifyuser
Settings.Description: See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Firefox3.6/Plugin_Update_Awareness_Security_Review for more info.

Settings.Name: geo.enabled
Settings.Description: Websites that use location-aware browsing will ask where you are in order to bring you more relevant information, or to save you time while searching. See http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/geolocation/

Settings.Name: geo.wifi.uri
Settings.FriendlyName: Geolocation URL to visit when using WiFi
Settings.Description: The URL to use when trying to use geolocation API with WiFi

Settings.Name: beacon.enabled
Settings.Description: The navigator.sendBeacon() method can be used to asynchronously transfer small HTTP data from the User Agent to a web server. See https://w3c.github.io/beacon/ for more info.

Settings.Name: device.sensors.enabled
Settings.Description: Master toggle to enable or disable all device sensors. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Sensor_API for more info.

Settings.Name: camera.control.face_detection.enabled
Settings.Description: Enable or disable face detection.

Settings.Name: media.navigator.enabled
Settings.Description: The Media Navigator is related to the mozGetUserMedia() function call. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Media/getUserMedia and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator for more info.

Settings.Name: media.peerconnection.enabled
Settings.Description: Control if WebRTC is turned on or off. WebRTC can be misused to expose the internal network IP address. The setting is related to the mozRTCPeerConnection() function call. Test WebRTC here http://mozilla.github.io/webrtc-landing/

Settings.Name: media.webspeech.recognition.enable
Settings.Description: This setting is part of the Web Speech API and enables the use of speech recognition on websites. See https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/speech-api/raw-file/tip/speechapi.html for more info.

Settings.Name: media.webspeech.synth.enabled
Settings.Description: This setting is part of the Web Speech API and enables the use of speech synthesis on websites. See https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/speech-api/raw-file/tip/speechapi.html for more info.

Settings.Name: media.getusermedia.screensharing.enabled
Settings.Description: Enable or disable screensharing using WebRTC. See https://www.webrtc-experiment.com/RTCMultiConnection/screen-sharing.html for more info.

Settings.Name: clipboard.autocopy
Settings.Description: In Linux and some UNIX-like platforms, selecting text will automatically copy the contents of the selection to the clipboard. Mozilla also follows this convention on these platforms. This preference controls that behavior.

Settings.Name: keyword.enabled
Settings.Description: When entering information in the Location Bar, Mozilla attempts to convert the information into a usable URI. For example, "mozilla.org" is automatically converted to "http://mozilla.org/". When Mozilla is unable to discern what URL the user wanted, the information that was entered may be submitted to an Internet Keywords service. This preference determines whether or not to use Internet Keywords.

Settings.Name: browser.fixup.alternate.enabled
Settings.Description: "Domain Guessing" enhances the Navigation toolbar's "Location" field by guessing other domain names when a user's original request cannot be found. Let us assume that the user's default domain name is "mcom.com".

Settings.Name: network.jar.open-unsafe-types
Settings.Description: Mozilla supports the jar: protocol, which allows the browser to directly load files inside JAR archives (and other files based on ZIP). Unfortunately, this feature can open up cross-site scripting issues on otherwise secure sites, by allowing script content to be loaded inside pages with the same permissions as the page itself. Another bug related to redirects compounded the problem, allowing any site with an open redirect to be compromised the same way, even if it hosted no JAR files.

Settings.Name: security.fileuri.strict_origin_policy
Settings.Description: When local HTML files (e.g., those located on your hard drive) are loaded into the browser, the scripts and links within have restrictions on what they can see and do. Those restrictions are determined by the same-origin policy for local files, which this preference controls.

Settings.Name: extensions.getaddons.cache.enabled
Settings.Description: Controls whether background metadata checks are made.

Settings.Name: network.dns.disableipv6
Settings.Description: One particular bug that has appeared exists not in Mozilla, but in IPv6-capable DNS servers: an IPv4 address may be returned when an IPv6 address is requested. It is possible for Mozilla to recover from this misinformation, but a significant delay is introduced. This preference globally disable IPv6 DNS lookups

Settings.Name: security.ask_for_password
Settings.Description: 0: Only the first time it's needed, 1: Every time it's needed, 2: Every n minutes, where n is the value in security.password_lifetime.

Settings.Name: browser.newtabpage.enabled
Settings.Description: See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Privacy/Reviews/New_Tab for more info.

Settings.Name: browser.newtab.url
Settings.Description: See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/new-tab-page-show-hide-and-customize-top-sites#w_how-do-i-turn-the-new-tab-page-off for more info.

Settings.Name: network.idn_show_punycode
Settings.Description: Browsers use Punycode to translate international domain names to something the DNS system can understand. Enable this to show the punycode in URLs. See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Network.IDN_show_punycode for more info.

Settings.Name: browser.urlbar.autofill
Settings.Description: Controls autofill in the URLbar. When you have visited a website, it gets stored in history. If you partially enter the name of a recently visited site in the urlbar, it will be autofilled with the closest match.

Settings.Name: browser.urlbar.autofill.typed
Settings.Description: When this is set to true it means that only addresses you've manually typed into the urlbar get autofilled. When the preference is set to false then all addresses stored in your history are eligible for autofill.

Settings.Name: browser.urlbar.maxrichresults
Settings.FriendlyName: The maximum number of rich search results
Settings.Description: Sets the number of rich results. Setting this to 0 effectively disables the Location Bar dropdown entirely. See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Browser.urlbar.maxRichResults for more info.
